page.title: 01General Long Marton Area
page.content: Our block is a good place to live.Quiet,beautiful and close to the lakes.There is room to play and enjoy outdoor hobbies like fishing,walking and climbing.People are friendly and used to visitors who can stay on a caravan site,bed and breakfast,self- catering in a holiday cottage or enjoy hotel luxury. The area contains a Roman fortress,a Roman camp,an old tithe barn and a section of the old Roman road.The church itself has a long history and many interesting features. The A66 is the main route for traffic from the industrial North East to Carlisle and the North or the lakes passes through. The Trout Beck rises in the fells, crosses the block,and joins the River Eden. The area is mostly grassland.
